channel.title: Switch vs. If-Else
channel.description:
This [b][u]Isn't[/u][/b] a "what is better" thread, I'm just wondering what you prefer.
Vote above, and if you want to explain why you chose what you did, please tell.
I prefer switch blocks, only because IMO, they are easier to view, and edit. Only nuisance is when you add a lot, and miss a break somewhere >.<

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I don’t care as long as it works

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:27, topic:457208”]I thought switch statements compiled into if statements in the end, so the efficiency wouldn’t matter. Just makes it look neater I guess.

Please correct me if I am wrong though.[/quote]

you’re right it really is personal preference, as others said before; it depends on the situation.

Read full topic

Perhaps the default case is for when you’re using ternary booleans!

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:18, topic:457208”][quote author=meiscooldude link=topic=560140.msg4091941#msg4091941 date=1346463243]
Its OK apparently to use If/Else where you should use switch, but if you use a switch were you are supposed to use If/Else, everyone gets pissed.


//Everyone at work yells at me for this.
switch(boolean)
{
     case True:
          break;
     case False:
          break;
     default:
          break;
}

[/quote]That is some of the most space-cluttering and pointless code I have seen. Default? What else is it going to be? Maybe? I would yell at you too if I saw it.[/quote]
Perhaps the default case is for when you’re using ternary booleans!

Read full topic

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

You really can’t choose one unless it’s a general situation, like the others said.

This is the best example

[quote=“zyle1992, post:10, topic:457208”][code=Java]
switch (isInWilderness()) {
case true:
// …
break;
case false:
// …
break;
}

switch (player.getUsername()) {
case “Someone”:
// …
}
[/code]

versus

if (player.isInWilderness()) { // ... } if (player.getUsername().equals("Someone")) { // ... } [/quote]

Read full topic

{

break;

break;
default:
break;
}

[/code][/quote]

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Prefer using switch statements, but there are times when if/else is simply easier to do something. I tend to use if/else more when working with results from SQL queries.

Read full topic

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“t4, post:12, topic:457208”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=560140.msg4091263#msg4091263 date=1346385738]
I’m surprised nobody has mentioned the Ternary.
[/quote]
you shouldn’t really be using ternary for switch/if logic[/quote]

True. It can be used for very-simple logic, but most people that I’ve come in contact with suggest not using it at all, because the only thing it saves is maybe a couple lines of code (it’s my understanding that it’s compiled to exactly the same instructions as an if-else).

Unless you’re competing in the obfuscation competition (can’t recall the name) where the object is to make things as complex as possible.

(somethingIsTrue()) ? doSomething() : doSomethingElse();

and

(age == 15) ? ((age > 14) ? ((age < 16) ? "You are 15" : "You are not 15") : "You are not 15") : "You are not 15"'

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:

I’m surprised nobody has mentioned the Ternary.

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

And how would you use a switch statement with a different expression?

switch (isInWilderness()) {
    case true:
        // ...
        break;
    case false:
        // ...
        break;
}

switch (player.getUsername()) {
    case "Someone":
        // ...
}

versus

if (player.isInWilderness()) {
    // ...
}
if (player.getUsername().equals("Someone")) {
    // ...
}

Read full topic

yeeeee.

item.title: Switch vs. If-Else
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

tyb97:

Well if you had the choice, which would you chose? Not situation specific. If you could, which would you use more often.

Do you prefer while or if?

When Switch statements are most useful I prefer them, and when if-else are more useful I use that.

Read full topic

Switch blocks is my answer.
